title: rclone mount failing at boot on new FreeBSD 12.1-RELEASE
body:
<!--

Welcome :-) We understand you are having a problem with rclone; we want to help you with that!

If you've just got a question or aren't sure if you've found a bug then please use the rclone forum:

    https://forum.rclone.org/

instead of filing an issue for a quick response.

If you think you might have found a bug, please can you try to replicate it with the latest beta?

    https://beta.rclone.org/
    
If you can still replicate it with the latest beta, then please fill in the info below which makes our lives much easier.  A log with -vv will make our day :-)

Thank you

The Rclone Developers

-->

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
I just updated my system to FreeBSD 12.1-RELEASE. Along with this release comes some improvements to fusefs, outlined here: https://svnweb.freebsd.org/base?view=revision&revision=352351
Another notable change is the kernel module loaded is now fusefs.ko instead of fuse.ko

Here is the problem: 
At boot I mount a gdrive using @reboot in my crontab with the following command:
@reboot rclone mount -vvv --allow-other --allow-non-empty --log-file /var/log/rclone.log --fast-list --vfs-read-chunk-size-limit off --timeout 1h --daemon --daemon-timeout 0 cachedrive: /mnt/gcache

Something goes wrong and it doesn't mount correctly, an error is attached below.
All I have to do is rerun the command from my terminal and everything mounts correctly. No other changes were made, just a simple running of the command again. 

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.49.4



#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
FreeBSD 12.1-RELEASE


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive 


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone mount -vvv --allow-other --allow-non-empty --log-file /var/log/rclone.log --fast-list --vfs-read-chunk-size-limit off --timeout 1h --daemon --daemon-timeout 0 cachedrive: /mnt/gcache
